Course Description: The primary aim of this course is to introduce students to vast, deep and rich world of Indian mythology. The course will seek to build a generic understanding of the Indian system of thought, with focus on stories as means of unraveling truth and building perspective.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Discuss and critique the concept of myth, mythology, history and related concepts.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Discuss and critique specific characters and events from Mahabharat and Ramayana.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Correlate and distinguish between the two epics.
Course Outcomes.CO4: Correlate and distinguish between the two epics.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Birth of Ram and Sita - The Lore and Symbolism
Dyut Sabha and Disrobing of Draupadi
Comparison of the two epics (continued into lecture 13)
